message: Hello there. Please do not bother me, I have a lot of work to do.
Hello. Could you please move out of the way? I am trying to work here.
Hi, kid.
Hi, kid.
Welcome to Stoutford kid.
My name is Cadoren. I'm the best cook in town.
Unlike most, lesser, cooks in local towns, I'm a specialist.

replies.text: Enough of the bragging. Show me what you have to trade.

message: Food that lasts a long time. *cough*. Or in some cases food that has already lasted a long time.

replies.text: That sounds interesting. Show me what you have.
Why do you need food that lasts a long time?

message: The path to Blackwater mountain has been cut off. There are also regular attacks by the Sakul. These things have driven down trade, making supplies hard to get.

replies.text: So all the food you sell is old?

message: Hello, welcome to my shop

replies.text: Please show me what you have to trade
What can you tell me about the town and local area?
I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me.

message: Stoutford is not a big town, but it used to be important.
Sorry, I don't recall seeing anyone like that recently. Most visitors go to the inn though, so you might have more luck asking there.
Oh. No one asked before you. I didn't even think about it.
Are you willing to hear my story ?

replies.text: If it can be of any comfort... go ahead.

message:
Thank you. My name is Aryfora.
I met my husband here in Stoutford, during the fair.
He offered me a beautiful flower, one that I had never seen before.

He was smart and handsome and we quickly fell in love.
He was from a town called Remgard.
His name was Noraed.
He told me that it is very far from here, beyond the river and the mountains.
I've never been there, as he always said how dangerous that road was, but every year, for our anniversary, he went back to bring me a Damerilia, the same flower he offered me on the day we met.

During one of the recent attacks on Stoutford, my husband sacrificed his life to save mine.
Now, I can't do anything but mourn next to his grave.
I'd really love to flower his grave with Damerilias, in memory of the symbol of our love.
But it would be reckless of me to ask such a young kid as you to go this far to the north-east.

replies.text: Don't worry about me. I can handle myself.
I'm an adventurer. I'm afraid of nothing.

message: Really ? If you manage to do it, I'll make sure to reward you with something only I can do, and that I haven't done in a long time.

replies.text: I guess I have work to do now.

message: That's a secret. You'll know when you'll see it.
Thank you for listening to me anyway. I hope you'll be fine.
You're back ! Have you found some Damerilias yet ?
Oh. Come back to me if you find some, ok ?
What a strange request !
Yes I happen to have some. Why are you asking ?

replies.text: There is this woman in Stoutford, she wants some for the grave of her husband, Noraed.

message: Noraed is dead ? Oh no.... poor little brother. What happened ?

replies.text: He was killed saving the life of his wife, during a monster attack on stoutford.

message: He loved her so much. I never had the chance to meet her.
Here, take these to her, and send her my condolances.

replies.text: Thanks. I'll make sure she gets them.
All this trouble for a bunch of smelly flowers...

message: Damerilias. I haven't seen one in a long time. Try with Caeda.
I have work to do now. Excuse me.
No. Excuse me, I have work to do.
Thank you very much for the flowers. Is there anything I can do for you ?

replies.text: Your potion was great ! Can I have some more ?

message: No sorry.

Oh. They're beautiful !
Thank you !
How did you find these flowers ?

replies.text: Noraed's sister, Caeda, gave them to me. She sends you her condolances.
I found them in the wild around Remgard.

message:
Is that so ?
Remgard must be a beautiful place to have such nice flowers growing in the wild.
Anyway. Thank you very much.

Noraed had a sister ? He never talked about his family.
He said he had a happy childhood, but that's it.
I think he didn't want me to ask to go there with him.
I'd love to meet her someday.

replies.text: I'm sure she feels the same.

message:
Welcome to my shop kid.
My potions are not for the faint of heart.
Do you want to take a look ?
I gave you my last one, and I can't brew potions anymore.
This is something I gave up long ago.
It's a long story.

My father was the alchemist of this town.
He was very talented, and inspired. He experimented with all sorts of ingredients from all over Dhayavar he could get with the travellers that stopped by Stoutford.
He created unique potions, and no other alchemist I heard of managed to reproduce his recipes.
When he deemed me old and responsible enough, he started teaching me his art.
He passed away a few years later. They said he poisoned himself during a new experiment, but I never believed it.
Our priest, Talahendor, was convinced by my uncle, Blornvale, my father's own brother.
My uncle also convinced the whole village that I was too young to be their alchemist, and that they needed him to take over the shop.

They all agreed, even though my uncle is a lousy alchemist.
I was sent to work in a farm, while my uncle took my father's house.
Everyone suffered from the nasty side-effects of my uncle's... I can't say potions... poisonous imitations of my father's recipes.
People complained at first, but nobody ever looked for a real solution.
Seeing how things turned out, I came to suspect that my uncle is responsible for my father's death.

replies.text: And, would you brew more potions if you had your father's shop back ?

message: No. Every time I talk to him, he denies everything, and call me crazy. I can tell he's lying though.

replies.text: And, would you brew more potions if you had your father's shop back ?

message: Maybe. If the villagers asked me to, and if they recognize the guilt of my uncle.

replies.text: Maybe I can help you do this.

message: Now that you mention it, I think I have a plan.
My uncle is very cautious with me, but with an unknown kid, there's a chance we can make him confess.
He's a dangerous man though. Are you sure you wish to confront him?

replies.text: I'd better leave. It's none of my business.

message: Then it's settled.
To begin, you'll have to buy some potions from him:
Talk to Yolgen. He handles such things for me.
We are on the road to Blackwater mountain, so many traders used to pass through Stoutford and stay at the inn.
That's all changed though. The path to Blackwater mountain has been blocked by a rockfall. There is also the prison that's just east of here.
Flagstone prison. We never liked it being so close. Who would? But recently something happened, and it was overrun by monsters.
There's a guard that protects the path, but without a good reason to come this way most people choose not to risk it. And then of course, there are the Sakul.

replies.text: I'm tired of hearing about your problems.

message: We don't know much about them, but they keep attacking our town.

replies.text: I'm sorry to hear about all the trouble, but there's something else I wanted to talk about.

message: We don't know where they came from, but they recently started attacking the town. We can fight them off, but they deter travelers from coming here.

replies.text: OK. Could you repeat what you said about that mountain.

message: Follow the path to the west. There are two settlements there, Prim and Blackwater Mountain Settlement. There has been a rockfall though, making it very difficult to get to them.

replies.text: Thanks for the information. What was it you said about the Sakul?

message: Of course not. We have some fields where we grow crops. And we have a number of goats.
Goats are very versatile. They eat almost anything, provide both milk and meat, and thier hides make excellent clothing.
With supplies from other towns being so limited, getting the goats was an excellent idea. My idea, of course.

replies.text: *Sigh*. The whole town would obviously starve if it were not for you. Thanks for the information though.
How about you quit with the bragging, and show me what you have to trade.
Whatever. Why don't we go back to what you said about the Sakul and that mountain.

message: Welcome to my shop. Are you looking for anything in particular?

replies.text: Please show me everything you have available.
I am looking for my brother, Andor. Have you seen anyone recently that looks a bit like me?
Can you tell me anything about Stoutford?

message: I did see someone that might have been your brother. He was with a rather dubious looking person. They didn't stay around here very long though. Sorry, but that's all I can tell you. You should ask around town. Other townsfolk may know more.

replies.text: Thanks. I'll go and do that now.
Please show me what you have to trade.
OK. Can you tell me anything about Stoutford?

message: Stoutford is a small town, and life used to be easy here. A lot of traders stayed in Stoutford on their way to and from Blackwater mountain, and spent money that boosted the economy of the whole town. Those days are gone though.
The path to Blackwater mountain was cut off by a rock fall. That stopped most of the traders from coming here. The attacks by the Sakul stopped the rest.

replies.text: How do I get to Blackwater mountain?

message: Just follow the path west, but you will have to find a way past the rockfall.

replies.text: Thanks for the directions. I'm headed there right now.

message: They started attacking the town recently. Nobody is sure why. Their attacks have been unsuccessful, so we are all hoping that they will give up soon and go back to wherever they came from.

replies.text: Thanks for the information, but I have to leave.
Thanks for the information. Do you have anything to trade?
Thanks. I'm looking for my brother, Andor. Has anyone new been through here recently?

message: Yes, indeed. My daughter has not come home for some days. I do not know what's wrong with her.

replies.text: And you have no idea where she might be?

message: I've been looking for her all over Stoutford. She does not leave the city. So she can only be in the castle, or kidnapped, or worse.

replies.text: Did you already look for her in the castle?

message: You can not go to the castle anymore, do not you know that? At least not if you want to continue living.

replies.text: I see. She will certainly reappear soon. In the meantime you could show me everything you have for sale.
I am also looking for someone: my brother, Andor. Have you seen anyone recently that looks a bit like me?
Ok. Can you tell me anything about Stoutford?
I'm not afraid. I could have a look in the castle.

message: You would do that for me? I can hardly accept your offer.

replies.text: But first I have something else.

message: Gyra is back and has told me everything. Many thanks again for your help.
Please give the helmet to his owner Lord Bourbon - eh, Lord Berbane I mean. He will be in the tavern.
Buzzzzz
Here lies Zorin, the first to tend this glade. Its beauty would be diminished without him.
You see large shapes moving in the shadows to the East. It looks dangerous that way!
They don't seem to want to come in your direction though. Maybe it has something to do with the statue?
Baaaaaa!
Fetch the flower?
You fetched the flower.
Fetch the flower?
You fetched the flower.
Fetch the flower?
You fetched the flower.
Fetch the flower?
You fetched the flower.
You fetched the flower.

Oh this is a long story my friend. This town has existed for ages and it used to be a prosperous and well visited outpost on the border of the Aewhata Kingdom. We used to trade with Fallhaven and Prim. This used to be the seat of Lord Erwyn of house Gorland. But during the Noble Wars 17 years ago, everything changed.

Oh the Noble Wars. It was one of the darkest parts of our history. They lasted only 3 years and brought great misery over our country. When out great King Luthor died and left the throne with no heir, the three mighty lords of the land soon enough began fighting over the title as successor. This was Lord Erwyn of Stoutford, Lord Geomyr of Feygard who used to be the advisor of King Luthor and Lord Emeric of Nor City. The former capital of Fallhaven first remained neutral.

While Erwyn and Emeric fought over the capture of the centre area, Lord Geomyr waited for the right moment and crushed his enemies with his great army. He rules the Kingdom ever since with an iron hand.

replies.text: Why do you say iron hand?

message: Well, he has installed garrisons in pretty much every village, introduced a tax system and now he even wants to prohibit the worship of the mighty Shadow! This is outrageous!

Oh well to the east where you came from, there's Flagstone Prison. To the south, there's Mt. Galmore. Definitely not a place where you want to go... To the west, we've got our so called railway terminal and beyond this point, you come to our border post at Blackwater River. Nothing but bogs and marshes westwards of this point. And finally, to the north, we had a tunnel to Prim and the Elm mine leading in the heart of Blackwater Mountain.

replies.text: Can you tell me more about Flagstone?
Can you tell me more about Mt. Galmore?
Can you tell me more about the west?
Can you tell me more about Blackwater Mountain?
There is something else I wanted to know.

message: Flagstone Prison was built a four hundred years ago by house Gorland of Stoutford and used right until the Noble Wars when the house was extinguished. They mostly detained people worshipping the old gods there. This dreadful place has been left abandoned ever since. Recently, however, undead started pouring out of the prison and we had to send guards to keep them away from the road.

replies.text: There was something else I wanted to know.

message: Mt. Galmore? It has been our scourge for a long time. Garthan I, the founder of Aewhata Kingdom, ordered the excavation of the mountain for gold and gems 430 years ago. As far as I recall, fortifications against the monster attacks were built and an enormous network of mine tunnels was dug under the mountain. They found plentiful ore veins and the mine flourished. But their success didn't last long. It is said, unspeakable horrors overwhelmed the knights and miners of the King after a few years and the mine has been left abandoned ever since. However more and more of the most foul monsters are coming down the mountain since then and we have to fend them off. Otherwise, the Kingdom would be overwhelmed by their numbers. With the rise of undead knights in the castle and Lord Erwyn's demise, we struggle more and more.

replies.text: That sounds dreadful. Is there anything I could do to help?
There was something else I wanted to know.

message: Well, you already were of great help. Thank you again!
Well, you look a bit young. But I guess we could still make use of you in these dark times. I have got some tasks I can offer you.

replies.text: What about the undead in the castle?

message: I hate this place. It rains all the time and I can't stand the eerie screams of the undead!
This is both good and bad news. I am truly grateful that you rid us of the warden and his thralls. Talk to Yolgen for a reward. We will make sure that we recover this prisoner.

replies.text: Thank you. Shadow be with you.

message: Oh this is good news! I am very pleased that the citizens of Stoutford have one thing less to worry about. It is only sad that we didn't send guards earlier on to investigate the prison. Then, all of this wouldn't have happened. Here take this gold.

replies.text: Thank you kindly. I am happy to help.
Thank you kindly. Shadow be with you.

message: Thanks to you my friend, we don't need to worry about the undead anymore.

replies.text: There was something else I wanted to know.

message: Bah, why did you ask then anyway?

We do have another problem. Our soldiers usually guard the castle gate to Mt. Galmore to keep the monsters away from the Kingdom. However, five days ago, the undead knights of Lord Erwyn started to rise from their grave. I've got no idea why this happened. We haven't been able to recapture the castle yet. I would ask you to rid us from this plague.

replies.text: It sounds more like a task for the guard. I'll go and talk to the captain of the guard.
No problem. They are already as good as dead.
Hm, I wonder where they came from.
No thank you. I think that's way over the top of my head.

message: As I said, we've got our railway terminal with all kinds of goods to the west. We used to trade food and tools with Prim and the miners from Elm mine and get loads of iron ingots instead. We shipped them further to Nor City and Feygard and prospered due to it. Further to the west, there's the border outpost right next to Blackwater River. Anyway, there's nothing but bogs, marshes and grasslands west of the river and some native tribes from what I heard.

replies.text: There was something else I wanted to know.

message: Ah another mortal! You shall be another servant in Lord Erwyn's army! Ha Ha!

replies.text: No, thank you. Maybe another time.

message: What do I seee? A mortal? Your bonesss shall be clattering on the ground soon enoughhh!

replies.text: No. How would that look like?

message: Ah, your ssskull will be my favorite cup!

replies.text: Yes, I also like it very much. So I'd rather keep it.

message: Bonesss! Niccce little bonesss!!
I shall crush you little mortal!

replies.text: For that you have to get me first, lazybones!

message: You see a heavily armed and cloaked skeleton moving towards you. This must be Lord Erwyn himself.
You shall die now mortal!

replies.text: No, you are going to die once and for all!

message: Let me see... You killed already some of Erwyn's undead knights and soldiers - if killed is the correct word for undead. But there are some still uproad.

replies.text: Ok, I will go and look for the rest.

message: Let me see... Ok, you killed all of the undead knights and soldiers who had worn Lord Erwyn's tattered banner.
And you slew Lord Erwyn's commander.
But their commander is still uproad.

replies.text: Ok, I will go and look for him.

message: And you slew Lord Erwyn himself.
But Lord Erwyn is still uproad.

replies.text: Ok, I will go and look for him.

message: That is unbelievable!

replies.text: Oh well, it was a tough fight. I managed to slay Lord Erwyn himself and found this ring among his remains.

message: I am very pleased to hear this. A ring you say? Let me take a look

Hmm. This looks most interesting. It is certainly some magical item and seems to have the powers to reanimate the dead. I am indeed very grateful that you brought this ring to me. We should destroy it once and for all to avoid further damage.

replies.text: Sounds fine by me. Anything for the safety of the people of Stoutford.

message: Yolgen puts the ring on his altar and chants a spell. Suddenly the altar seems to be getting darker and darker and then the ring cracks.

This is it. The ring is destroyed. I just wonder where it came from. Maybe from the depths of Mt. Galmore or some mischievous traveller put it on Lord Erwyn's remains? Anyway, my friend, I and the people of Stoutford are most grateful. Here is your reward.

replies.text: Thank you. Shadow be with you.

message: Oh Blackwater Mountain. This is a long story as well. We used to trade food and tools with Prim and the miners from Elm mine and get loads of iron ingots instead. We shipped them further to Nor City and Feygard and prospered due to it.

A few months ago, everything changed. Suddenly, a violent earthquake shook the mountain and our railway tunnel to Prim collapsed. Pretty much at the same time, those Gornaud beasts attacked us and with all the trouble we're having, we haven't been able to restore the tunnel yet and our trade declines. There hasn't been any contact with Prim after this. Therefore, also less travellers are coming from Fallhaven and Nor City. It's a shame.

replies.text: Is there anything I can help with?
There was something else I wanted to know.

message:
* Welcome to Stoutford * 

(scribbled below) Death awaits you
These are hard days. It is nice to see kids like you still strolling around.
It is a lovely day for a drink. Come and join me.

replies.text: Thank you, maybe some other time.

message: Hey, kid, get ouf of here immediatly!
Hey, kid, what are you doing here?
Get out! But immediately, naughty child!
My name is Borlag. I am chief of the local guards here.

replies.text: Aha. And why are you sitting here in your tower instead of driving the undead out of the castle?
What are you doing here at the moment?

message: Oh, I'm working on a strategy to win back the castle. I have already made 17 plans. Now I have to compare and rate them.
So young and already hanging around in taverns?

replies.text: No, I am looking for my brother Andor. Maybe you have seen him?
At least I am not drinking whole bottles of my own, like that guy next table.

message: Yes, I have seen a boy that looks a bit like you. Not too long ago. But he is gone and I can not say where he was bound to.

replies.text: What a pity. Now, at least someone has seen him. Better than nothing.

message: Well spoken. I hope for you that you will choose other amusements.

replies.text: He looks rather well off. Who is he?

message: This is Lord Bourbon ... - I mean Lord Berbane of Stoutford. His name invites for nasty pun, but honestly, he does not much to show a different character.
Lord Bourbon sits there every evening, drinking or telling fairy tales. Or he plays lute and sing to it. I must admit he has a comfortable voice.

replies.text: Is he the heir of Stoutford Castle?

message: Exactly, although there is not much heirloom left. And the castle is almost in ruins, now after the raid.
And now you should run home and go to bed. Your parents should take better care of you and your brothers.
The richly dressed man does not react.

replies.text: Yolgen asked me to help clearing the castle of undeads. Shall we do it together?
Gyra had found your helmet and asked me to give it to you. So that you could start to clear the castle.
The castle is clean from undead now.

message: Gyra? My dearest and most eager listener?
Many of my songs are about this magical helmet. But it's all just songs.

replies.text: Will you make the songs a reality now?
I cleared the castle from undead already.

message: He sighed and slowly took the helmet.
Lord Bourbon looks sadly at his bottle, but still shows no sign to get up.
Lord Bourbon is singing merrily about his heroic deeds.
Lord Berbane jumps up and cried with a loud voice: SILENCE!
(loud voice) Hear and listen everybody! The castle is free! The trembling is over!
(loud voice) My trainee and me, we were in the castle. I demonstrated how to fight properly. Especially Lord Erwyn himself was a good demonstration object.
(loud voice) But we will come to the details later - after the local round
(loud voice) Of course - you have carried my magical helmet for me. I take it back now.
(loud voice) Of course - you have learned much from me. But no need to thank me now.

(low voice) Well-behaved. 
(loud voice) And now mead for everyone! Let's be merry! Forget all sorrows!
Oh, then does the shift end?? I want to have a some cold mead right now.
Stoutford shall prevail in these hard times, traveler.
Hi kid. It is nice and warm here near to the fire. Come and make yourself comfortable.

replies.text: Ah no, thank you. I like to do more interesting things to do now.

message: What do you do out here all alone?

replies.text: I am looking for my brother Andor. You have not seen him by chance?

message: No. We're in a military exercise right now.
We just saw another horde of undead approach the castle when we left. We hurry here now, so that we are back in time to be able to help.

replies.text: You mean, you ran away just in time before you got involved in the fight?

message: Ouh, that does not sound nice, as you put it.

replies.text: Cowardice. I'll report that to your commander.
I better leave now. And you need not hurry with your exercise. All your comrades have been killed already by the undead.

message: No, you won't.
Hi kid, should we play hide and seek?

replies.text: Oh yes, I love hide and seek!
Leave me alone, I am too old for silly games.

message: Great! Count to ten, then I am hidden.

replies.text:
Ok, I'll close my eyes now.
1, 2, 3 ...

message: I am ready!
You found me too quickly! Once more, please. Count to ten again!
Hey, you found me again! Once more?
You didn't count to 10! Don't cheat. Another time!
Are you sure you didn't cheat this time?

replies.text: Of course not. Then hide yourself again, quick! 1, 2, 3 ...

message: Found me again! Once ...
How did you know I'm here?

replies.text: I won't reveal my secrets so easy. Now disappear, I'm counting already.  1, 2, 3 ...

message: No! Wait!
This took you a bit longer now to find me!
You woldn't lie in this bed.
Beam me up - enabled.
Help! You must help me! Please!

replies.text: What is your problem, my little one?

message: I am Gyra, Odirath's daughter. I was looking for Lord Bourbon's helmet, when I was surprised by these monsters.
So I hid here in the storeroom and didn't dare to leave the hiding place.

replies.text: Eh, I will be back soon. Maybe. But - probably not, no. I hate kids.
Of course I will help you. Just follow me.

message: Please go ahead. I will follow you, probably.

replies.text: Ok, just stay close to me.
Let me carry you for a while.

message: I will follow you, wherever you go. Only if I'm too scared, then I stay where I am. For example I will never go to Flagstone.
You may carry me from time to time. I'll jump off your arm again when I'm rested.
NO! Please not through the gate! I won't go there!
No! Please not to Flagstone! I won't go there!
Now I know the way. I run to my dad and tell him the whole story.
No, I won't go home without the helmet! We must go back and find it. You promised to help me with this.
You don't need to carry me anymore, I can walk myself again.
I think that Lord Bourbon's helmet must be somewhere in a castle building.
To find the helmet, we should search really all the rooms of the castle.
I have a feeling that we are very close.
Look there, under the bed!
And now back home quickly!

replies.text: I would never have found the helmet without you.

message: Look there, in the bed!
Look there, behind the crack in the wall!
Greetings, $playername! Come, sit down and chat with me a little bit over a cup of tea.
Would you like a cup of good southern blend?
Here you are.

replies.text: Who are you and how do you know my name?

message: (chuckles) Very clever. You can not trust strangers nowadays.

replies.text: Who are you and how do you know my name?
Right. That's why I'm going now.

message: You have not done all fights. What are you doing here then?
Oh, I know many things. A good leader has to be attentively.

replies.text: You are commanding the undead soldiers down there?

message: No, do not be worried. I have nothing to do with the undead here in the castle. I just think them interesting.
I am Colonel Lutarc, maybe you have already heard of me? Not? However.

replies.text: May I ask what you are doing here?

message: Can't you see that? I enjoy my tea here. It is a splendid place, I really like it here.

replies.text: From here you have a nice view.

message: Indeed. I come often to watch my warriors down there as they fight.
How easily you killed the undead knight was nice to look at.

replies.text: Oh that - small thing for me ...

message: How easily you killed the undead soldier was nice to look at.

replies.text: Oh that - small thing for me ...

message: I'm always impressed when I see a good fighter at work.
Now I am curious how you could handle a number of my better warriors. Would you like to try?

replies.text: Sure. After I have finished my tea of course.
Why not? A little change is always good.
Maybe some other time. I have to leave now.

message: Take your time.
Good. Please go to the foot of this hill, right down there, by the gate.
There I will have five of my more interesting fighters compete against you.
One after the other of course ...
Go now. Show me what you can do.
Get ready now for your first fight.
Have a lizard as warm up.
Not bad for the first one. Let's have the next.
Lost the first fight already. Well, let's have the next.

replies.text: This time I will make more effort.

message: Ready for your second fight?
Just some bones - should be easy.
Nicely done. Let's have the next.
Lost the second fight. Well, I have three more for you.

replies.text: Let me catch my breath for a moment.

message: Well, get ready now.
$playername! What do you think you are doing?!
We need you at home. Andor is back since long, and we have our hands full trying to control the rat plague.
Come with me now. And give me back my ring.

replies.text: Sure, here is your ring. It was very useful in the beginning, but now I don't need it anymore.
I don't have it anymore, sorry.
(Lie) I don't have it anymore, sorry.
(Lie) I don't have it anymore, sorry. This ring on my finger just looks similar.

message:
[Ring taken]
Thank you, stupid.
You think yourself clever? Useless kid!
Double surprise!
Surprise!
I am impressed. You won the fight with my poser.
A poser could imitate someone you have in mind lately. And if you give him some object, then he turns it into a second duplicate.

replies.text: Yes, but two Mikhails were a little bit too conspicuous.

message: A poser could imitate one person you have in mind lately, if you don't give him anything.

replies.text: So Mikhail wasn't really here and I didn't kill him. I'm relieved.

message: I knew you would lose this one.
Now to your next opponent.
This one looks like a little dragon.
Nicely done.
Lost against a little worm. Well, well, well.
Your last opponent will be something big. Don't underestimate him.

replies.text: I hope it will last a bit longer than the others.

message: Come, Bully
That was it. Relax a bit.
Lost the last fight, of course. I thought so.

replies.text: This one was far too strong indeed.

message: Come up to me now.
Lost all fights. I really did not expect such a bad result from you.

replies.text: They were far too strong, and they all fighted in an unfair way.

message: You won every single fight! Very good! I had not enjoyed myself so much for a long time.
I did not expect you to win against all of my fighters. But good to know for sure. Thank you for testing out.

replies.text: If you have more for me, just call.

message: Take this medallion as a token of thanks.

replies.text: Very kind of you. Oh, how lovely! There is a tiny little lizard on it. It looks completely real, just like the lizard I was fighting against.

message: Go now. I have to think.
Greetings, $playername.
Stop! You do not have permission to withdraw already. Go back to the fights.
You hear some mechanism rattle.
Neigh!
Neigh!!!

replies.text: One could think you want something from me.
Haha, I think I'm going crazy. Horses can't talk.

message: Neigh! Neigh!!! neigh.

replies.text: Oh I see now. They left you here without anything to drink. Wait, Here is a bucket of water.
Slowly you become annoying. I'm leaving now.

message: (after drinking greedily) Neiiieieiiigh!!

replies.text: There, now you feel better! I have to leave now.

message: Neigh.
Please don't kill me! I am too young to die.

replies.text: Eh, you do know that you are already dead?

message: Oh.
